title: Prime Minister of the Czech Republic
summary: The chairman of the Government of the Czech Republic (Czech: Předseda vlády České republiky), commonly referred to in English as the prime minister of the Czech Republic,[note 1] is the head of the Government of the Czech Republic. The prime minister and Cabinet (consisting of all the most senior ministers, who are government ministries heads) are collectively accountable for their policies and actions to the Chamber of Deputies. The current prime minister, Andrej Babiš, leader of the ANO 2011, was appointed by the president on 6 December 2017, and serves as 12th person in the office.
